Get to Know Us:
It’s fun to work in a company where people truly believe in what they’re doing!
At BlackLine, we’re committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business of enterprise applications.
Since being founded in 2001, BlackLine has become a leading provider of cloud software that automates and controls the entire financial close process. Our vision is to modernize the finance and accounting function to enable greater operational effectiveness and agility, and we are committed to delivering innovative solutions and services to empower accounting and finance leaders around the world to achieve Modern Finance.
Being a best-in-class SaaS Company, we understand that bringing in new ideas and innovative technology is mission critical. At BlackLine we are always working with new, cutting edge technology that encourages our teams to learn something new and expand their creativity and technical skillset that will accelerate their careers.
Work, Play and Grow at BlackLine!
Make Your Mark:
Blackline is seeking a dynamic and ambitious Data Scientist to join our team and play a pivotal role in building and enhancing our predictive analytics capabilities. This position will focus on marketing, sales and customer analytics, including the development of prediction and forecast models related to pipeline creation, sales performance, and customer retention. With a core emphasis on a collaborative and learning-oriented environment, this role will contribute to the ongoing success of BlackLine by extracting actionable insights from data.
You’ll Get To:
Data Management:
Utilize Google BigQuery to transform data from various sources
Develop, inspect, mine, and model data to enhance productivity, improve decision-making, and gain a competitive advantage
Assist in developing and promoting a “one source of truth” for data consistency and accuracy
Predictive modeling:
Collbaborate with Go-To-Market teams to design and build machine learning and statistical models, enhancing pipeline creation, lead conversion, customer retention, and cross-sell effectiveness
Work closely with the finance team to develop accurate pipeline, revenue and retention forecast models
Communication:
Build strong relationships and partner with business leaders to understand their analytical needs and assess high-impact opportunities for the business
Use data to inform key business decisions and communicate findings effectively with senior leadership
Training/Enablement:
Collaborate and build credibility with internal business teams, staying up to date on new initiatives and understanding their data needs while managing expectations and providing guidance on best practices
Stay current with technical and industry advances
What You’ll Bring:
Years of Experience in Related Field: 3-7 Education: Bachelors or similar degree Technical/Specialized Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
Bachelor’s degree in a related field (e.g. Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related quantitative discipline)
3+ years of experience in data science with multiple models deployed in an operational setting
Expert level knowledge in SQL and python programming
Experience with data visuzlation tools (e.g. Tableau, Power BI)
Proven ability to communicate findings and insights effectively to support business decision-making
We’re Even More Excited If You Have:
Previous exposure to cloud technologies, specifically Google Cloud Platform, Google BigQuery, and Google Vertex AI, is a big plus.
Solid understanding of Go-To-Market strategies and related business concepts
Thrive at BlackLine Because You Are Joining:
A technology-based company with a sense of adventure and a vision for the future. Every door at BlackLine is open. Just bring your brains, your problem-solving skills, and be part of a winning team at the world’s most trusted name in Finance Automation!
A culture that is kind, open, and accepting. It’s a place where people can embrace what makes them unique, and the mix of cultural backgrounds and varying interests cultivates diverse thought and perspectives.
A culture where BlackLiner’s continued growth and learning is empowered. BlackLine offers a wide variety of professional development seminars and inclusive affinity groups to celebrate and support our diversity.
BlackLine is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity or expression, race, age, religious creed, national origin, physical or mental disability, ancestry, color, marital status, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, sexual assault or stalking, medical condition, genetic information, or any other protected class or category recognized by applicable equal employment opportunity or other similar laws.

USD $113,900.00 - USD $175,900.00

Descriptions:
Employment Information
Job level
Medium level
Industry
Software Development

2+ years

Saint Louis, MO, United States
About Us
At 1904labs, we are a human-centered technology company that focuses on using modern tools and technologies to solve enterprise organizations' crunchiest challenges. We look for innovative, courageous, intensely curious, and team-minded people. At 1904labs, we are committed to providing each team member with opportunities that will allow personal and professional growth.
The Role
As a Data Scientist at 1904labs, you will work in an Agile environment while leveraging our clients' data to implement data science algorithms as scalable, hosted services. You will be responsible for conceptualizing and executing projects from start to finish, identifying the appropriate data and methodologies to answer business questions using best practices and innovative approaches.
Responsibilities
Perform data analysis to understand the right combinations of data to meet objectives
Translate client queries into actionable data pulls and help translate outputs into client strategies
Develop dashboard-style visualizations and user interfaces to machine learning utilities
Build and evaluate predictive modeling & machine learning utilities to produce meaningful outcomes that enable data-led decisions
Translate analysis results into actionable insights
Present insights to both technical and non-technical audiences
Work with development teams and/or ML Ops Engineers to implement data science algorithms as scalable, hosted services
Maintain and enrich a productive relationship with client-side data scientists and data professionals
Requirements
Experience coding in an object-oriented language suited for machine learning systems such as Python (not reliant on GUI-based systems to execute analysis) for the purpose of cleaning, manipulating, visualizing, and analyzing data
Proficient knowledge of linear algebra, statistics, probability, and numerical analysis.
Experience working with data to perform operations such as Extract-Transform-Load, data manipulation for analysis, data visualization, etc.
2+ years of professional experience with data analysis techniques such as:
Hypothesis testing, time series analysis, computational simulation, exploratory analysis, clustering, etc.
Proficient with Machine Learning Analysis: Execute, evaluate, and apply various models such as:
Logistic regression, random forests/decision tree, nearest neighbors, neural net, support vector machine, an ensemble of multiple models, etc.
Desired Skills
Bachelors Degree in Statistics, Mathematics or Computer Science
Experience with software engineering and developing deployable API services
Drive to learn new technologies and frameworks
Experience with browser-based interactive computational environments (like Jupyter Notebook).
Tools: Spark, Pandas, SciKit-Learn, TensorFlow, Keras, SQL
Desires to understand the business needs and translate that into requirements.
Enjoys explaining the analysis process and translating results into actionable insights for both technical and non-technical audiences.
Why Choose 1904labs?
Innovation Hours - 10% of our work week is set aside to work on our own ideas and projects. We believe that giving folks the time and space to innovate and tinker allows them to bring fresh ideas and perspectives to the work we do.
Innovation First - work where it makes sense - each day we want you, in conversation with your team, to work from where it makes the most sense.
Competitive salary, bonus, and benefits (medical, dental, paid parental leave, 401k match).
We invest in the personal and professional growth of every employee because we believe growth leads to innovative solutions and personal fulfillment.
Career paths are crafted by you and supported and nurtured by 1904labs.
Experienced team made up of intensely curious and innovative thinkers from a variety of disciplines who inspire each other to come up with the best solutions possible.
Being a trusted advisor to our clients allows us to affect change within their organizations.
We work to create an intentional culture crafted around promoting and supporting the needs of our employees as whole people.
Flexible schedules and a Human-Centered approach to work.
Strong commitment to the community. Take advantage of the relationships we’ve built with our established community partners or pursue any other community endeavor you are passionate about.
The offered salary will be dependent upon experience
Don’t meet every requirement? No problem. We encourage you to apply if your skills and experience align without meeting all requirements. Senior level

Industry

Experience
9+ years

San Diego, CA, United States
UC San Diego values equity, diversity, and inclusion. If you are interested in being part of our team, possess the needed licensure and certifications, and feel that you have most of the qualifications and/or transferable skills for a job opening, we strongly encourage you to apply.
This position will work a hybrid schedule which includes a combination of working both onsite at Towne Centre Drive and remote.
Description
This is a staff data scientist role with the Joan & Irwin Jacobs Center for Health Innovation (JCHI). The data scientist is responsible for working on all phases of AI model design and development including but not limited to, intake & review, data prep, model development, evaluation, pre-deployment prep, deployment, and post-deployment model monitoring & management.
JCHI is advancing its healthcare data science platform, primarily hosted in AWS as well as developing a wide range of AI models using traditional, LLM, and hybrid models. All models are intended to be deployed enterprise wide, with EHR integration (where applicable), with recommended interventions.
Minimum qualifications
Nine (9) years of related experience, education/training, OR a Bachelor’s degree in related area plus five (5) years of related experience/training. Related experience: healthcare EHR data (e.g., Epic).
Advanced knowledge of HPC / data science / CI.
Special conditions
Must be able to work various hours and locations based on business needs.
Employment is subject to a criminal background check and pre-employment physical.

Our facilities include two university hospitals, a National Cancer Institute-designated Comprehensive Cancer Center, Shiley Eye Institute, Sulpizio Cardiovascular Center, the only Burn Center in the county, and and dozens of outpatient clinics. We invite you to join our team!
